title: When Can I Quit? Calculator
description: Calculate when you can realistically quit your job based on savings, expenses, and investment returns.
methodSummary: Time calculation uses compound interest formula solving for months at the given expected return.
assumptions: Assumes your expenses remain constant over time.
Net salary is estimated at 75% of gross for savings calculations.
insights: Every $100 you cut from your monthly expenses reduces your required 'Financial Independence' target by $30,000.
A 6-month buffer is often the 'minimum viable' runway to test a new career path or business idea.

faqs.a: It suggests that once you have 25 times your annual expenses saved, you can potentially live off the returns indefinitely (The 4% Rule).
6 months provides most professionals enough time to find a comparable job if a new venture fails, reducing the risk of 'quitting'.
Yes, recurring side income directly reduces the amount you need to save from your main salary to reach your goal.
It is a mathematical projection. Real-world inflation and market volatility will impact the actual date.

faqs.q: What if my expenses change after I quit?
faqs.a: Enter the amount you expect to spend *after* quitting to get a more accurate 'Safe Quit' target.
No, returns fluctuate. Use a conservative number (like 4-5%) for more realistic long-term planning.
